page.title: 05TRANSPORT
page.content: Until 1959 Billingborough had a railway station. We now have 5 bus services which go to our nearest towns -Bourne,Boston,Grantham,Sleaford and Spalding.Most of these services run on the towns' market days and there are no buses on Sundays. Residents of outlying hamlets such as Stow and Birthorpe have to come into Billingborough to catch the buses. Some of the bus routes go through Horbling but the people have to walk to Billingborough to catch those which do not. Most people find it more convenient to have their own cars as the buses are infrequent.
